news_header: An 86-year-old man in Kansas City, Missouri, pleaded guilty to second-degree assault for shooting Ralph Yarl, a 16-year-old who mistakenly went to the wrong address.
news_original_title: Man pleads guilty in shooting of US teen Ralph Yarl
news_text: The incident sparked debates over stand your ground laws and raised concerns about racial justice, as Yarl is Black and Lester is white. Lester claimed self-defense, believing Yarl was attempting to break in. He faces sentencing on March 7, with a maximum of seven years in prison.
